definition: understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
lit. Sima Zhao's intentions are obvious to everyone (idiom)/fig. an open secret
pinyin: Si1 ma3 Zhao1 zhi1 xin1 lu4 ren2 jie1 zhi1

sentences.english: Passersby, one by one, threw paper money and coins into the small bucket beside his feet.
sentences.chinese: 過路人紛紛向他腳下的一個小鐵桶裏扔着紙幣和硬幣。

sentences.english: Bamboo fence that lines the dying rose, hurt people 's heart.
sentences.chinese: 竹籬笆旁那株即將凋謝的玫瑰，刺痛了路人的心。

sentences.english: I shouted to the pedestrians for help, but no one stopped.
sentences.chinese: 我大喊着向行人道上的路人求助，但是沒有人停下來。

sentences.english: Two people are at a French château.
sentences.chinese: 這兩位路人在一座法國古堡中就餐。

sentences.english: Good luck, let's hope he is not afraid of hitchhikers.
sentences.chinese: 祝你走運，但願他不害怕路人搭車。

sentences.english: Teachers to do a guide, students can learn self-protect.
sentences.chinese: 教師要做一個領路人，爲學生的自能學習保駕護航。

sentences.english: We're just a passer-by yibingding, in this world collective game.
sentences.chinese: 我們只是路人甲乙丙丁，在這花花世界集體遊戲。

sentences.english: Actually that thinly veiled propaganda was in yesterdays article.
sentences.chinese: 事實上這個路人皆知的宣傳在昨天的文章中就有了。

sentences.english: He is standing in front of the supermarket, passing out flyers to customers.
sentences.chinese: 他站在超市前面，向過往的路人發傳單。

sentences.english: The guides, as always, lie among the writers and artists.
sentences.chinese: 領路人依舊在作家和藝術家之中。

sentences.english: Ann: Honestly, there are so many beggars who are pretended to cheat the passerby.
sentences.chinese: 老實說，很多乞丐都是假裝的，以此來騙路人的錢。

sentences.english: A young boy was arrested by the police for robbing passengers.
sentences.chinese: 一名少年因攔路搶劫路人被警方拘留。

sentences.english: Here he would jump on unsuspecting passersby, as Xenophon records.
sentences.chinese: 據色諾頓的記載，他會向毫無準備的路人發問。

sentences.english: She leaned out of the window and hailed a passerby.
sentences.chinese: 她探出車窗口，向一個過路人打招呼。

sentences.english: Some try to hand me money they don't understand.
sentences.chinese: 有過路人想扔錢給我，他們並不知道。

definition: to stand in a circle and watch
father's elder brother's wife/aunt (affectionate term for an elderly woman)
